   19: %%
   20: -module(core_fold_no_copt_ssa_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 t_element/1,setelement/1,t_length/1,append/1,t_apply/1,bifs/1,
   25: 	 eq/1,nested_call_in_case/1,guard_try_catch/1,coverage/1,
   26: 	 unused_multiple_values_error/1,unused_multiple_values/1,
   27: 	 multiple_aliases/1,redundant_boolean_clauses/1,
   28: 	 mixed_matching_clauses/1,unnecessary_building/1,
   29: 	 no_no_file/1,configuration/1,supplies/1,
   30:          redundant_stack_frame/1,export_from_case/1,
   31:          empty_values/1,cover_letrec_effect/1,
   32:          receive_effect/1,nested_lets/1,
   33:          map_effect/1]).
   34: 
   35: -export([foo/0,foo/1,foo/2,foo/3]).
   36: 
   37: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   38: 
   39: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   40: 
   41: all() -> 
   42:     [{group,p}].
   43: 
   44: groups() -> 
   45:     [{p,[parallel],
   46:       [t_element,setelement,t_length,append,t_apply,bifs,
   47:        eq,nested_call_in_case,guard_try_catch,coverage,
   48:        unused_multiple_values_error,unused_multiple_values,
   49:        multiple_aliases,redundant_boolean_clauses,
   50:        mixed_matching_clauses,unnecessary_building,
   51:        no_no_file,configuration,supplies,
   52:        redundant_stack_frame,export_from_case,
   53:        empty_values,cover_letrec_effect,
   54:        receive_effect,nested_lets,
   55:        map_effect]}].
   56: 
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   62:     ok.
   63: 
   64: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: 
   71: t_element(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72:     X = make_ref(),
   73:     X = id(element(1, {X,y,z})),
   74:     b = id(element(2, {a,b,c,d})),
   75:     (fun() ->
   76: 	    case {a,#{k=>X}} of
   77: 		{a,#{k:=X}}=Tuple ->
   78: 		    #{k:=X} = id(element(2, Tuple))
   79: 	    end
   80:     end)(),
   81: 
   82:     %% No optimization, but should work.
   83:     Tuple = id({x,y,z}),
   84:     Pos = id(3),
   85:     x = id(element(1, Tuple)),
   86:     c = id(element(Pos, {a,b,c,d})),
   87:     X = id(element(Pos, {a,b,X,d})),
   88:     z = id(element(Pos, Tuple)),
   89: 
   90:     %% Calls that will fail.
   91:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(5, {a,b,c,d})),
   92:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(5, {a,b,X,d})),
   93:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(5.0, {a,b,X,d})),
   94:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(2, not_a_tuple)),
   95:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(2, [])),
   96:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(2, Tuple == 3)),
   97:     case id({a,b,c}) of
   98: 	{_,_,_}=Tup ->
   99: 	    {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(4, Tup))
  100:     end,
  101:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch element(1, tuple_size(Tuple))),
  102: 
  103:     ok.
  104: 
  105: setelement(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  106:     X = id(b),
  107:     New = id([1,2,3]),
  108:     {y,b,c} = id(setelement(1, {a,b,c}, y)),
  109:     {y,b,c} = id(setelement(1, {a,X,c}, y)),
  110:     {a,y,c} = id(setelement(2, {a,X,c}, y)),
  111:     {a,[1,2,3],c} = id(setelement(2, {a,b,c}, New)),
  112:     {a,[1,2,3],c} = id(setelement(2, {a,X,c}, New)),
  113:     {a,b,[1,2,3]} = id(setelement(3, {a,b,c}, New)),
  114:     {a,b,[1,2,3]} = id(setelement(3, {a,X,c}, New)),
  115: 
  116:     {{d,c,b,a,x}, {z,c,b,a,x}} = setelement_cover(erlang:make_tuple(5, x)),
  117: 
  118:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch setelement_crash({a,b,c,d,e,f})),
  119:     error = setelement_crash_2({a,b,c,d,e,f}, <<42>>),
  120: 
  121:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch setelement(1, not_a_tuple, New)),
  122:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch setelement(3, {a,b}, New)),
  123: 
  124:     ok.
  125: 
  126: setelement_cover(T0) ->
  127:     T1 = setelement(4, T0, a),
  128:     T2 = setelement(3, T1, b),
  129:     T3 = setelement(2, T2, c),
  130:     T4 = setelement(1, T3, d),
  131:     T5 = setelement(1, T3, z),
  132:     {T4,T5}.
  133: 
  134: setelement_crash(Tuple) ->
  135:     %% Used to crash the compiler because sys_core_dsetel did not notice that
  136:     %% X1 was used in bit syntax construction.
  137:     X1 = setelement(5, Tuple, new),
  138:     X2 = setelement(3, X1, new),
  139:     {X2,<<X1>>}.
  140: 
  141: setelement_crash_2(Tuple, Bin) ->
  142:     %% Used to crash the compiler because sys_core_dsetel did not notice that
  143:     %% X1 was used as a size field in bit syntax matching.
  144:     X1 = setelement(5, Tuple, new),
  145:     X2 = setelement(3, X1, new),
  146:     case Bin of
  147: 	<<42:X1>> -> X2;
  148: 	_ -> error
  149:     end.
  150: 
  151: t_length(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  152:     Blurf = id({blurf,a,b}),
  153:     Tail = id([42,43,44,45]),
  154:     0 = id(length([])),
  155:     1 = id(length([x])),
  156:     2 = id(length([x,Blurf])),
  157:     4 = id(length([x,Blurf,a,b])),
  158: 
  159:     %% No or partial optimization.
  160:     4 = length(Tail),
  161:     5 = id(length([x|Tail])),
  162: 
  163:     %% Will fail.
  164:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch id(length([a,b|c]))),
  165:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch id(length([a,Blurf|c]))),
  166:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch id(length(atom))),
  167: 
  168:     ok.
  169: 
  170: -define(APPEND(A, B), (fun(Res) ->
  171: 			       Res = lists:append(A, B),
  172: 			       Res = erlang:append(A, B),
  173: 			       Res = erlang:'++'(A, B)
  174: 		       end)(A++B)).
  175: 
  176: append(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  177:     A = id(0),
  178:     [a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,i,j,k] = id(?APPEND([a,b,c,d,e,f],[g,h,i,j,k])),
  179:     [a,b,c,d,e] = id(?APPEND([a,b,c],id([d,e]))),
  180:     [0,1,2,3,4,5,6] = id(?APPEND([A,1,2,3],[4,5,6])),
  181:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch id(?APPEND([A|blurf],[4,5,6]))),
  182:     ok.
  183: 
  184: t_apply(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  185:     ok = apply(?MODULE, foo, []),
  186:     4 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [3]),
  187:     7 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [3,4]),
  188:     12 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [id(8),4]),
  189:     21 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [8,id(9),4]),
  190:     20 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [8,8,id(4)]),
  191:     24 = apply(?MODULE, foo, [id(10),10,4]),
  192: 
  193:     M = id(?MODULE),
  194:     ok = apply(M, foo, []),
  195:     4 = apply(M, foo, [3]),
  196:     16.0 = apply(M, foo, [12.0,4]),
  197: 
  198:     %% Will fail.
  199:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply([a,b,c], foo, [])),
  200:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(42, foo, [])),
  201:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(?MODULE, 45, [xx])),
  202:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(?MODULE, foo, {a,b})),
  203:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(M, M, [1009|10010])),
  204:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(?MODULE, foo, [10000|9999])),
  205:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch apply(?MODULE, foo, a)),
  206: 
  207:     ok.
  208: 
  209: foo() ->
  210:     ok.
  211: 
  212: foo(A) ->
  213:     A+1.
  214: 
  215: foo(A, B) ->
  216:     A + B.
  217: 
  218: foo(A, B, C) ->
  219:     A + B + C.
  220: 
  221: bifs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  222:     <<1,2,3,4>> = id(list_to_binary([1,2,3,4])),
  223:     K = {a,key},
  224:     V = {a,value},
  225:     {ok,#{K:=V}} = id(list_to_tuple([ok,#{K=>V}])),
  226:     ok.
  227: 
  228: -define(CMP_SAME0(A0, B), (fun(A) -> true = A == B, false = A /= B end)(id(A0))).
  229: -define(CMP_SAME1(A0, B), (fun(A) -> false = A /= B, true = A == B end)(id(A0))).
  230: -define(CMP_SAME(A0, B), (true = ?CMP_SAME0(A0, B) =:= not ?CMP_SAME1(A0, B))).
  231: 
  232: -define(CMP_DIFF0(A0, B), (fun(A) -> false = A == B, true = A /= B end)(id(A0))).
  233: -define(CMP_DIFF1(A0, B), (fun(A) -> true = A /= B, false = A == B end)(id(A0))).
  234: -define(CMP_DIFF(A0, B), (true = ?CMP_DIFF0(A0, B) =:= not ?CMP_DIFF1(A0, B))).
  235: 
  236: eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  237:     ?CMP_SAME([a,b,c], [a,b,c]),
  238:     ?CMP_SAME([42.0], [42.0]),
  239:     ?CMP_SAME([42], [42]),
  240:     ?CMP_SAME([42.0], [42]),
  241: 
  242:     ?CMP_DIFF(a, [a]),
  243:     ?CMP_DIFF(a, {1,2,3}),
  244: 
  245:     ?CMP_SAME(#{a=>1.0,b=>2}, #{b=>2.0,a=>1}),
  246:     ?CMP_SAME(#{a=>[1.0],b=>[2]}, #{b=>[2.0],a=>[1]}),
  247: 
  248:     %% The rule for comparing keys are different in 17.x and 18.x.
  249:     %% Just test that the results are consistent.
  250:     Bool = id(#{1=>a}) == id(#{1.0=>a}),	%Unoptimizable.
  251:     Bool = id(#{1=>a}) == #{1.0=>a},		%Optimizable.
  252:     Bool = #{1=>a} == #{1.0=>a},		%Optimizable.
  253:     io:format("Bool = ~p\n", [Bool]),
  254: 
  255:     ok.
  256: 
  257: %% OTP-7117.
  258: nested_call_in_case(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  259:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  260:     Dir = test_lib:get_data_dir(Config),
  261:     Core = filename:join(Dir, "nested_call_in_case"),
  262:     Opts = [from_core,{outdir,PrivDir}|test_lib:opt_opts(?MODULE)],
  263:     io:format("~p", [Opts]),
  264:     {ok,Mod} = c:c(Core, Opts),
  265:     yes = Mod:a([1,2,3], 2),
  266:     no = Mod:a([1,2,3], 4),
  267:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch Mod:a(not_a_list, 42)),
  268:     _ = code:delete(Mod),
  269:     _ = code:purge(Mod),
  270:     ok.
  271: 
  272: guard_try_catch(_Config) ->
  273:     false = do_guard_try_catch(key, value),
  274:     value = get(key),
  275:     ok.
  276: 
  277: do_guard_try_catch(K, V) ->
  278:     %% This try...catch block looks like a guard.
  279:     %% Make sure that it is not optimized like a guard
  280:     %% (the put/2 call must not be optimized away).
  281:     try
  282: 	put(K, V),
  283: 	false
  284:     catch
  285: 	_:_ ->
  286: 	    false
  287:     end.
  288: 
  289: -record(cover_opt_guard_try, {list=[]}).
  290: 
  291: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  292:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,{a,b,c}},_}} =
  293: 	(catch cover_will_match_list_type({a,b,c})),
  294:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,{a,b,c,d}},_}} =
  295: 	(catch cover_will_match_list_type({a,b,c,d})),
  296:     a = cover_remove_non_vars_alias({a,b,c}),
  297:     error = cover_will_match_lit_list(),
  298:     {ok,[a]} = cover_is_safe_bool_expr(a),
  299:     false = cover_is_safe_bool_expr2(a),
  300:     ok = cover_eval_is_function(fun id/1),
  301: 
  302:     ok = cover_opt_guard_try(#cover_opt_guard_try{list=[a]}),
  303:     error = cover_opt_guard_try(#cover_opt_guard_try{list=[]}),
  304: 
  305:     %% Make sure that we don't attempt to make literals
  306:     %% out of pids. (Putting a pid into a #c_literal{}
  307:     %% would crash later compiler passes.)
  308:     case list_to_pid("<0.42.0>") of
  309: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> ok
  310:     end,
  311: 
  312:     %% Cover the non-variable case in bsm_do_an/4.
  313:     ok = bsm_an_inlined(<<1>>, Config),
  314:     error = bsm_an_inlined(<<1,2,3>>, Config),
  315:     error = bsm_an_inlined([], Config),
  316: 
  317:     %% Cover eval_rel_op/4.
  318:     Tuple = id({a,b}),
  319:     false = case Tuple of
  320: 		{_,_} ->
  321: 		    Tuple =:= true
  322: 	    end,
  323: 
  324:     %% Cover is literal_fun/1.
  325:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,42},_}} = (catch cover_is_literal_fun()),
  326: 
  327:     %% Cover core_lib.
  328:     ok = cover_core_lib([ok,nok]),
  329: 
  330:     ok.
  331: 
  332: cover_will_match_list_type(A) ->
  333:     case A of
  334: 	{a,_,_} ->				%Set type of A to {a,_,_}.
  335: 	    case A of
  336: 		{a,_,_,_} -> ok			%Compare type and pattern.
  337: 	    end
  338:     end.
  339: 
  340: %% Make sure the remove_non_vars/4 can handle aliases in the type argument.
  341: cover_remove_non_vars_alias(X) ->
  342:     case X of
  343: 	{a=Y,_,_} ->				%Set type of A to {a=Y,_,_}.
  344: 	    case X of
  345: 		{_,_,_} ->			%Compare type and pattern.
  346: 		    Y
  347: 	    end
  348:     end.
  349: 
  350: cover_will_match_lit_list() ->
  351:     case {1,2,3} of				%Literal case expression.
  352: 	{_,$A,$A} ->				%Pattern that does not match.
  353: 	    ok;
  354: 	_ ->
  355: 	    error
  356:     end.
  357: 
  358: cover_is_safe_bool_expr(X) ->
  359:     %% Use a try...catch that looks like a try...catch in a guard.
  360:     try
  361: 	%% let V = [X] in {ok,V}
  362: 	%%    is_safe_simple([X]) ==> true
  363: 	%%    is_safe_bool_expr([X]) ==> false
  364: 	V = [X],
  365: 	{ok,V}
  366:     catch
  367: 	_:_ ->
  368: 	    false
  369:     end.
  370: 
  371: cover_is_safe_bool_expr2(X) ->
  372:     try
  373: 	V = [X],
  374:     is_function(V, 1)
  375:     catch
  376: 	_:_ ->
  377: 	    false
  378:     end.
  379: 
  380: cover_opt_guard_try(Msg) ->
  381:     if
  382: 	length(Msg#cover_opt_guard_try.list) =/= 1 ->
  383: 	    error;
  384: 	true ->
  385: 	    ok
  386:     end.
  387: 
  388: cover_eval_is_function(X) ->
  389:     case X of
  390:         {a,_} -> is_function(X);
  391:         _ -> ok
  392:     end.
  393: 
  394: bsm_an_inlined(<<_:8>>, _) -> ok;
  395: bsm_an_inlined(_, _) -> error.
  396: 
  397: cover_is_literal_fun() ->
  398:     [case id(42) of
  399:          [] ->
  400:              try right of
  401:                  wrong -> true
  402:              catch
  403:                  error:_ -> error
  404:              end
  405:      end]().
  406: 
  407: cover_core_lib(Modules) ->
  408:     R = id(Modules),
  409:     _ = [id(Error) || Error <- R, element(1, Error) =/= ok],
  410:     ok.
  411: 
  412: unused_multiple_values_error(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  413:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  414:     Dir = test_lib:get_data_dir(Config),
  415:     Core = filename:join(Dir, "unused_multiple_values_error"),
  416:     Opts = [no_copt,clint,ssalint,return,from_core,{outdir,PrivDir}
  417: 	   |test_lib:opt_opts(?MODULE)],
  418:     {error,[{"unused_multiple_values_error",
  419: 	     [{none,core_lint,{return_mismatch,{hello,1}}}]}],
  420:      []} = c:c(Core, Opts),
  421:     ok.
  422: 
  423: unused_multiple_values(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  424:     put(unused_multiple_values, []),
  425:     [false] = test_unused_multiple_values(false),
  426:     [b,a,{a,b},false] = test_unused_multiple_values({a,b}),
  427:     ok.
  428: 
  429: test_unused_multiple_values(X) ->
  430:     ok = do_unused_multiple_values(X),
  431:     get(unused_multiple_values).
  432: 
  433: do_unused_multiple_values(X) ->
  434:     case do_something(X) of
  435:         false ->
  436:             A = false;
  437:         Res ->
  438:             {A,B} = Res,
  439:             do_something(A),
  440:             do_something(B)
  441:     end,
  442:     _ThisShouldNotFail = A,
  443:     ok.
  444: 
  445: do_something(I) ->
  446:     put(unused_multiple_values,
  447: 	[I|get(unused_multiple_values)]),
  448:     I.
  449: 
  450: 
  451: %% Make sure that multiple aliases does not cause
  452: %% the case expression to be evaluated twice.
  453: multiple_aliases(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  454:     do_ma(fun() ->
  455: 		  X = Y = run_once(),
  456: 		  {X,Y}
  457: 	  end, {ok,ok}),
  458:     do_ma(fun() ->
  459: 		  case {true,run_once()} of
  460: 		      {true=A=B,ok=X=Y} ->
  461: 			  {A,B,X,Y}
  462: 		  end
  463: 	  end, {true,true,ok,ok}),
  464:     ok.
  465: 
  466: do_ma(Fun, Expected) when is_function(Fun, 0) ->
  467:     Expected = Fun(),
  468:     ran_once = erase(run_once),
  469:     ok.
  470: 
  471: run_once() ->
  472:     undefined = put(run_once, ran_once),
  473:     ok.
  474: 
  475: 
  476: redundant_boolean_clauses(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  477:   X = id(0),
  478:   yes = case X == 0 of
  479:             false -> no;
  480:             false -> no;
  481:             true -> yes
  482:         end.
  483: 
  484: mixed_matching_clauses(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  485:   0 = case #{} of
  486:           #{} -> 0;
  487:           a -> 1
  488:       end,
  489:   0 = case <<>> of
  490:           <<>> -> 0;
  491:           a -> 1
  492:       end,
  493:   ok.
  494: 
  495: unnecessary_building(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  496:     Term1 = do_unnecessary_building_1(test_lib:id(a)),
  497:     [{a,a},{a,a}] = Term1,
  498:     7 = erts_debug:size(Term1),
  499: 
  500:     %% The Input term should not be rebuilt (thus, it should
  501:     %% only be counted once in the size of the combined term).
  502:     Input = test_lib:id({a,b,c}),
  503:     Term2 = test_lib:id(do_unnecessary_building_2(Input)),
  504:     {b,[{a,b,c},none],x} = Term2,
  505:     4+4+4+2 = erts_debug:size([Term2|Input]),
  506: 
  507:     ok.
  508: 
  509: do_unnecessary_building_1(S) ->
  510:     %% The tuple must only be built once.
  511:     F0 = F1 = {S,S},
  512:     [F0,F1].
  513: 
  514: do_unnecessary_building_2({a,_,_}=T) ->
  515:     %% The T term should not be rebuilt.
  516:     {b,
  517:      [_,_] = [T,none],
  518:      x}.
  519: 
  520: %% This test tests that v3_core has provided annotations and that
  521: %% sys_core_fold retains them, so that warnings produced by
  522: %% sys_core_fold will have proper filenames and line numbers. Thus, no
  523: %% "no_file" warnings.
  524: no_no_file(_Config) ->
  525:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,0},_}} = (catch source(true, any)),
  526:     surgery = (tim(#{reduction => any}))(),
  527: 
  528:     false = soul(#{[] => true}),
  529:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,true},_}} = (catch soul(#{[] => false})),
  530: 
  531:     ok = experiment(),
  532:     ok.
  533: 
  534: source(true, Activities) ->
  535:     case 0 of
  536: 	Activities when [] ->
  537: 	    Activities
  538:     end.
  539: 
  540: tim(#{reduction := _Emergency}) ->
  541:     try
  542: 	fun() -> surgery end
  543:     catch
  544: 	_ when [] ->
  545: 	    planet
  546:     end.
  547: 
  548: soul(#{[] := Properly}) ->
  549:     not case true of
  550: 	    Properly -> true;
  551: 	    Properly -> 0
  552: 	end.
  553: 
  554: experiment() ->
  555:     case kingdom of
  556: 	_ ->
  557: 	    +case "map" of
  558: 		 _ -> 0.0
  559: 	     end
  560:     end,
  561:     ok.
  562: 
  563: 
  564: %% Make sure we don't try to move a fun into a guard.
  565: configuration(_Config) ->
  566:     {'EXIT',_} = (catch configuration()),
  567:     ok.
  568: 
  569: configuration() ->
  570:     [forgotten || _Components <- enemy, is_tuple(fun art/0)].
  571: 
  572: art() ->
  573:  creating.
  574: 
  575: %% core_lint would complain after optimization. A call to error/1
  576: %% must not occur unconditionally in a guard.
  577: supplies(_Config) ->
  578:     case ?MODULE of
  579: 	core_fold_inline_SUITE ->
  580: 	    %% Other error behaviour when inlined.
  581: 	    ok;
  582: 	_ ->
  583: 	    {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch do_supplies(#{1 => <<1,2,3>>})),
  584: 	    {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch do_supplies(#{1 => a})),
  585: 	    {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch do_supplies(42)),
  586: 	    ok
  587:     end.
  588: 
  589: do_supplies(#{1 := Value}) when byte_size(Value), byte_size(kg) -> working.
  590: 
  591: redundant_stack_frame(_Config) ->
  592:     {1,2} = do_redundant_stack_frame(#{x=>1,y=>2}),
  593:     {'EXIT',{{badkey,_,x},_}} = (catch do_redundant_stack_frame(#{y=>2})),
  594:     {'EXIT',{{badkey,_,y},_}} = (catch do_redundant_stack_frame(#{x=>1})),
  595:     ok.
  596: 
  597: do_redundant_stack_frame(Map) ->
  598:     %% There should not be a stack frame for this function.
  599:     X = case Map of
  600:             #{x := X0} ->
  601:                 X0;
  602:             #{} ->
  603:                 erlang:error({badkey, Map, x})
  604:         end,
  605:     Y = case Map of
  606:             #{y := Y0} ->
  607:                 Y0;
  608:             #{} ->
  609:                 erlang:error({badkey, Map, y})
  610:         end,
  611:     {X, Y}.
  612: 
  613: %% Cover some clauses in sys_core_fold:remove_first_value/2.
  614: 
  615: -record(export_from_case, {val}).
  616: 
  617: export_from_case(_Config) ->
  618:     a = export_from_case_1(true),
  619:     b = export_from_case_1(false),
  620: 
  621:     R = #export_from_case{val=0},
  622:     {ok,R} = export_from_case_2(false, R),
  623:     {ok,#export_from_case{val=42}} = export_from_case_2(true, R),
  624: 
  625:     ok.
  626: 
  627: export_from_case_1(Bool) ->
  628:     case Bool of
  629:         true ->
  630:             id(42),
  631:             Result = a;
  632:         false ->
  633:             Result = b
  634:     end,
  635:     id(Result).
  636: 
  637: export_from_case_2(Bool, Rec) ->
  638:     case Bool of
  639:         false ->
  640:             Result = Rec;
  641:         true ->
  642:             Result = Rec#export_from_case{val=42}
  643:     end,
  644:     {ok,Result}.
  645: 
  646: empty_values(_Config) ->
  647:     case ?MODULE of
  648:         core_fold_inline_SUITE ->
  649:             {'EXIT',_} = (catch do_empty_values());
  650:         _ ->
  651:             {'EXIT',{function_clause,_}} = (catch do_empty_values())
  652:     end,
  653:     ok.
  654: 
  655: do_empty_values() when (#{})#{} ->
  656:     c.
  657: 
  658: cover_letrec_effect(_Config) ->
  659:     self() ! {tag,42},
  660:     _ = try
  661:             try
  662:                 ignore
  663:             after
  664:                 receive
  665:                     {tag,Int}=Term ->
  666:                         Res = #{k => {Term,<<Int:16>>}},
  667:                         self() ! Res
  668:                 end
  669:             end
  670:         after
  671:             ok
  672:         end,
  673:     receive
  674:         Any ->
  675:             #{k := {{tag,42},<<42:16>>}} = Any
  676:     end,
  677: 
  678:     _ = catch cover_letrec_effect_1(),
  679:     _ = catch cover_letrec_effect_2(),
  680: 
  681:     ok.
  682: 
  683: cover_letrec_effect_1() ->
  684:     try
  685:         _ = catch ""
  686:     after
  687:         case any_atom of
  688:             31 when any_atom, force ->
  689:                 true
  690:         end,
  691:         case "RG" of
  692:             1 when car, cdr, 3; 3, 4 ->
  693:                 false
  694:         end
  695:     end.
  696: 
  697: cover_letrec_effect_2() ->
  698:     maybe
  699: 	<< ok || ok, _ <- (catch ok)>>,
  700: 	ok
  701:     end.
  702: 
  703: receive_effect(_Config) ->
  704:     self() ! whatever,
  705:     {} = do_receive_effect(),
  706:     ok.
  707: 
  708: do_receive_effect() ->
  709:     {} = receive _ -> {} = {} end.
  710: 
  711: nested_lets(_Config) ->
  712:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,ok},_}} = catch nested_lets_1(<<42>>),
  713:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch nested_lets_2(id(0), id(0)),
  714:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch nested_lets_3(),
  715:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = catch nested_lets_4(),
  716:     {'EXIT',{{case_clause,_},_}} = catch nested_lets_5(),
  717:     {'EXIT',{badarith,_}} = catch nested_lets_6(),
  718: 
  719:     ok.
  720: 
  721: %% GH-6572: Deeply nested `let` expressions caused `sys_core_fold` to generate
  722: %% unsafe code that it would attempt to fix up later. Unfortunately it did so
  723: %% through a limited fixpoint iteration, and would leak said code once the
  724: %% limit was hit.
  725: nested_lets_1(<<X>>) ->
  726:     Y =
  727:         case ok of
  728:             X ->
  729:                 true = (ok > (Y = -1)),
  730:                 <<>> =
  731:                     {id(
  732:                        <<
  733:                          (ok - ok),
  734:                          (bnot ok),
  735:                          (nested_lets_1_f() band ok),
  736:                          (nested_lets_1_f()),
  737:                          (not ok),
  738:                          (ok or nested_lets_1_f()),
  739:                          (id(
  740:                             id(
  741:                               <<
  742:                                 (id(
  743:                                    <<
  744:                                      (id(
  745:                                         <<0 || _ <- []>>
  746:                                        ))
  747:                                    >>
  748:                                   ) * ok)
  749:                               >>
  750:                              )
  751:                            ))
  752:                        >>
  753:                       )}
  754:         end.
  755: 
  756: nested_lets_1_f() ->
  757:     ok.
  758: 
  759: %% GH-6612: A variant of GH-6572 that slipped through the initial fix.
  760: nested_lets_2(X, 0) ->
  761:     try
  762:         0 = {
  763:              _ = 0 + 0,
  764:              Z = bnot ok,
  765:              {(_ = ok), (_ = X)}#{ok => ok},
  766:              ok +
  767:                  (nested_lets_2_f(
  768:                     ok +
  769:                         nested_lets_2_f(
  770:                           ok +
  771:                               (nested_lets_2_f(
  772:                                                 (Y =
  773:                                                      -nested_lets_2_f(
  774:                                                         #{
  775:                                                             (ok +
  776:                                                                  (ok +
  777:                                                                       nested_lets_2_f(
  778:                                                                         case
  779:                                                                             try ok of
  780:                                                                                 _ ->
  781:                                                                                     fun(_) ->
  782:                                                                                             ok
  783:                                                                                     end
  784:                                                                             after
  785:                                                                                 ok
  786:                                                                             end
  787:                                                                         of
  788:                                                                             #{} ->
  789:                                                                                 ok
  790:                                                                         end
  791:                                                                        ))) => ok
  792:                                                          } > ok
  793:                                                        ))
  794:                                 ) + ok)
  795:                          ) >
  796:                         ok
  797:                    ))
  798:             }
  799:     of
  800:         _ ->
  801:             Z;
  802:         _ ->
  803:             Y
  804:     after
  805:         ok
  806:     end.
  807: 
  808: nested_lets_2_f(_) ->
  809:     ok.
  810: 
  811: nested_lets_3() ->
  812:     try ((true = [X | _]) = (ok * (_ = ok))) of
  813:         _ ->
  814:             X
  815:     after
  816:         ok
  817:     end.
  818: 
  819: nested_lets_4() ->
  820:     try
  821:         not (case {(_ = ok), (Y = ?MODULE:undef())} of
  822:             a ->
  823:                 ok;
  824:             0 ->
  825:                 ok
  826:         end)
  827:     of
  828:         _ ->
  829:             Y
  830:     after
  831:         ok
  832:     end.
  833: 
  834: %% GH-6633.
  835: nested_lets_5() ->
  836:     case self() of
  837:         [_ | X] ->
  838:             ok;
  839:         false ->
  840:             {ok#{
  841:                 (X = ok) :=
  842:                     ((ok /=
  843:                         maybe
  844:                             ok
  845:                         end) =/= ok)
  846:             }}
  847:     end,
  848:     X.
  849: 
  850: %% GH-6635.
  851: nested_lets_6() ->
  852:     try {not (false orelse (ok#{(1 / 0) := ok})), X = ok} of
  853:         X ->
  854:             ok
  855:     after
  856:         ok
  857:     end.
  858: 
  859: map_effect(_Config) ->
  860:     {'EXIT',{{badkey,key},_}} = catch map_effect_1(),
  861: 
  862:     {'EXIT',{{badkey,key},_}} = catch map_effect_2(#{}),
  863:     {'EXIT',{{badmap,no_map},_}} = catch map_effect_2(no_map),
  864: 
  865:     ok.
  866: 
  867: map_effect_1() ->
  868:     #{}#{key := value},
  869:     ok.
  870: 
  871: map_effect_2(Map) ->
  872:     Map#{key := value},
  873:     ok.
  874: 
  875: %%% Common utility functions.
  876: 
  877: id(I) -> I.
